mainApp.title: Junk News Aggregator
mainApp.header: Junk News Aggregator
mainApp.homeDescription: This aggregator shows English language junk news stories posted on Facebook in the context of the 2018 US miterm elections. The term “junk news” is defined in our methodology. The posts shown on this page are at most 24 hours old. Please visit the Archive for older posts.
mainApp.archiveDescription: This archive shows English language junk news stories posted on Facebook more than 24 hours ago, in the context of the 2018 US miterm elections. The term “junk news” is defined in our methodology.
mainApp.footer: DISCLAIMER: This aggregator identifies "junk news" sites based on a grounded typology tested in several scientific studies conducted by the COMPROP research group. It reflects our scientific opinion and evaluation (the basis of opinion is described in our methodology), and does not necessarily reflect the views of our funders or the University of Oxford.

top10MiniApp.title: Junk News Aggregator - Top 10
top10MiniApp.header: Junk News Aggregator - Top 10
top10MiniApp.description: This Top 10 aggregator shows the top 10 English language junk news stories posted on Facebook in the last 24 hours, in the context of the 2018 US midterm elections. It is updated daily at 5pm ET. This aggregator shows the top 10 posts in terms of the total number of reactions they have received per second of their life, from time posted to time retrieved by our system (i.e. the "age-adjusted total" metric). Please see the methodology section for more details, including how we the term "junk news" is defined. This is a smaller version of the full Junk News Aggregator, available here.
top10MiniApp.footer: DISCLAIMER: This aggregator identifies "junk news" sites based on a grounded typology tested in several scientific studies conducted by the COMPROP research group. It reflects our scientific opinion and evaluation (the basis of opinion is described in our methodology), and does not necessarily reflect the views of our funders or the University of Oxford.
